summary: This document is an NCIC (National Crime Information Center) delayed response page showing a search request from the Federal Protective Service in New York. It indicates a search was conducted based on a Social Security number, but no NCIC wants or warrants were found. The document includes security warnings about proper use of NCIC information.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency responding to the NCIC inquiry.

events.title: NCIC Search Request
events.description: A search of NCIC Person Files was conducted based on a Social Security number, with no wants or warrants found.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: An NCIC search was conducted based on a Social Security number (NYFPSOOSO) with no wants or warrants found.
The search was requested by the US Department of Homeland Security - ICE - Federal Protective Service in New York.
The document contains strict warnings about unauthorized release of NCIC information, referencing Title 28, Part 20 of the Code of Federal Regulations.
The response indicates a 'QWA' search was performed, which searches all NCIC Persons Files without limitations.
The document date is December 11, 2019, suggesting investigative activity around that time.
